intro: Glochidion pitcairnense, commonly known as the Pitcairn glochidion, is a small shrub native to the island of Pitcairn in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Glochidion pitcairnense is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and thrives in well-drained soils.
